reviewText:
I knew exactly what to expect when I bought this game as it was released (which I think the Â£11 price point is great, including 33% off too, awesome!)

I have everything set to Extra High and it's running super smooth, keyboard and mouse seems to feel pretty good although I still went for an Xbox pad as I just prefer it for third person based games.

After playing my first playthrough, I'm really exciting for Phantom Pain now, if it runs as smoothly as this but features the huge open world and of course the conclusion to the story,  I shall definatly be doing several more playthroughs to get all the unlocks and do the side missions.  I think I spend 20 minutes just listening to the lore/audio logs and taking my time, with an overall completion of just under 2 hours.

This might actually be the first game i'll try and 100% complete.  Only at 8% currently, so much to do!

I've been a fan of the Metal Gear games for many years and was hoping that with the several terrible PC ports/releases this year, that Metal Gear would not fall into the same boat and happily it does not, the FOX engine seems really well optimized for PC.  Hell, it runs so well I might even be persuaded to pre-purchase Phantom Pain, something i've not done since the whole Colonial Marines debacle.

It's good to get back to a Metal Gear style game, I've missed the action sneaking for a while now, there's others like Splinter Cell but I don't know, Metal Gear always seems to have it's own charm that nothing can match.

In closing I'd recommend this to any Metal Gear fan, especially for it's current price.  Of course it's not a full game but it's not a paid demo either, there's plenty to do and yes maybe if you rush it and spoil it for yourself you can complete it in 20 minutes but that really isn't the point of this whole thing.  The real fans will enjoy it and see it for what it is.  A good taste of what to expect next year!

reviewText:
I'm a huge Metal Gear Solid fan but I was skeptical about the port to steam since, let's face it, many console ports haven't made a smooth transition to pc as of late but Kojima definitely ensured a quality port that actually ends up feeling like its native platform was pc to begin with.

Mouse and keyboard support is spot on! the keys are mapped in a very intuitive way, keys are also stream lined so that several keys share different functions rather than having to contort a finger reaching for some ridiclous punctuation key. Most console ports have been plagued with mouse smoothing (which can't be disabled in some cases) but right from the get-gp the mouse is precise and responsive, unfortunately there is no mouse support in the menus but meh, that's really a small nit pick.

Anyone complaining that Ground Zeroes doesn't pack a lot of content is sorely mistaken. The main campaign takes at least an hour for skilled players to complete on normal difficulty (far more if you try to accomplish challenges and play on hard difficulty) plus there is a slew of side missions. All in all this demo" as people call it can easily run you 30 to 40 hours of gameplay
date: which isn't too shabby for the price.\n\nEither way Ground Zeroes accomplishes what it sets out to do in the first place: It makes me want Metal Gear Solid 5 The Phantom Pain far more than I already did to begin with so hurry the **** up already Kojima! I want more!!"

reviewText: MGSV:GZ is the prologue/tech demo for MGSV: The Phantom Pain, which will be coming out in late 2015. Metal Gear Solid is an action series that focuses on stealth, which means that instead of running around gunning everyone down, you are encouraged to sneak around enemies without getting caught (you can still gun down everyone if you're REALLY good). Ground Zeroes only contains a single stage, but there are multiple missions that can be played on said stage, increasing the replayability. As a MGS fan, I found the missions and the upgraded mechanics to be very engaging, and ended up playing this over and over as if it were an arcadie indie game. One downer was that I had to unlock the HARD difficulty, which is what I would rather have started with seeing as NORMAL is ridiculously easy, but I'm just nitpicking at this point. I recommend this tech demo to fans of any other stealth game, especially if it's on sale.

reviewText: Where to start... I've been a fan of the Metal Gear series for 16 years now. I've seen and experiences the games change and evolve one by one. Either for better or for worse in some cases. In the case of Ground Zeroes, the series has evolved for the better and the best. I have over 30 hours played on my PS4 and I decided to rebuy it on my PC just to play through it and support its developers. In no way is this game a demo" as many people say. Yes
recommended: but it was advertised as a prologue. It has the main mission along with side missions
hoursPlayed: two if them being fun extra ops missions. One feautures Snake and another features Raiden from Metal Gear Rising.\n\nGameplay. The shooting system is perfect for a stealth/shooter hybrid. You can go in stealthy or go in guns blazing. The stealth system has no percentage on the corner of your screen anymore. You just use your thinking about whether the enemy can spot you there
voteText:
and judge it from there. No more hands helping you out. The only thing helping you out would be the reflex mode which can be turned off. Reflex mode is a new feature introduced in MGSV that slows down time so you can react and shoot a guard and either kill or tranqualize him before an alert is triggered.

Quality. The quality is as MGS as it can get. Always superb as usual with the new story telling design Kojima is trying to push. The graphics are sharp and great which makes you want to just look around the environment and forget your objective.

Story. It continues off from where peacewalker left us. I wont spoil it but it's a cliffhanger that will lead up to The Phantom Pain which should release on 2015.

Controls. I myself use my dualshock 4 to play on the PC so I'm not really sure how they are on KB/M. But I'm sure it's pretty challenging since the DS4 can barely use all the buttons to map the controls. But they did a job well done.

For a price of $13.49 this was a steal. The replayability to unlock all items

Never thought I would play MGS game on PC in recent years, until I saw this and the Phantom Pain. Though this is a very short game, it has high replayability.
Best of all, I never thought the game would play so smoothly on PC. It's a great example of how to port a console game to PC, even though all games are made on PC initially anyway!
The gaming experience is further enhaced thanks to full controller support and fluid, simple and intuitive keyboard and mouse support. Anyone who has never played this on console would think it is actually a PC game, ported to console.

Stay tuned for MGS Phantom Pain, and until that time, keep yourself busy playing this amazing short mission. Worth every penny.

//Besides, it's good to see Snake on PC/Steam.
Hope to see more future MGS games and old ones to be here as well.

reviewText: if you like tactical stealth games similar to splinter cell, assasins creed and hitman, then you'll love this game. It is also very challenging in my opinion; having to constantly mark enemies and interrogate people to make the misson less difficult gives this game a very realistic feel. there are also a very wide variety of ways to complete the missions compared to other stealth games which makes this game very unique. just F.Y.I normal difficulty feels like hard difficulty to me. So, for you hardcore perfectionist gamers you can try and ace the normal mode then ace the hard mode. This game is without a doubt challenging and fun, and i challenge any one who is interested in this game to ace all the missions in all difficulties. great game
